column4: I highly doubt that Joe Consumer would have gone through the troubles I went to to install feisty fawn
Talk to Dell about that =P
lol, how'd you know? ;)
heh heh.  Linux is very user friendly it's just picky on who it chooses as friends!
I use linux for everything other than the two apps I have that require windows
Aye same here I have been using linux full time for about 8 years now.  Started with Redhat and Suse and recently moved to Ubuntu about 2 years ago
i stopped for a while because I needed all the hdd space for video and such, but now with UbuntuStudio, I don't have an excuse [although the video editing software at the moment has issues]
Isn't that what a MAC is for?? /duck
isn't what what a MAC is for?
LOL that's from what ... an hour ago? =P
yea, my battery died
DOH!
again, a dell
Awwww well at least it wasn't an exploding battery!
no, its the 4th full replacement for the model that caught fire at trade shows
Wow #4 ... what model of Dell?  Is it one of the "end user" models?  I've never liked those.  I use the Precision M65 series
end user model /shudder
Try the Precision series you will love them!
it had better specs than anything else they sold at the time
